alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 3:22PM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Dobson Pass, Wallace, Kellogg, Mullan, Fourth Of July Pass, Lookout Pass, Osburn, Fernwood, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Afternoon and evening snow showers will produce bursts of locally heavy snow capable of quick 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Motorists may encounter poor visibility and locally slick or slushy roads this afternoon and this evening especially above elevations of 3000 feet including Lookout Pass and Fourth of July Pass on Interstate 90.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
